title: How to Enjoy Your Birthday at School

steps.title: Even though it seems a little bit early, a time of about 9:30 pm (or earlier) is good for teenagers, or who will be the next day!
steps.content: Even though it seems a little bit early, a time of about 9:30 pm (or earlier) is good for teenagers, or who will be the next day! Being tired may ruin your day and you might suffer from tiredness, lack of concentration and headaches. Avoid it by getting the sleep you need. Use a comfy pillow and duvet, take a shower,and do some reading before you switch out the light, as this could help you to sleep better.

steps.title: Get ready for school and look forward to everyone saying happy birthday!
steps.content: Get ready for school and look forward to everyone saying happy birthday! Have everything ready. After all, it would be a shame to get to school late and miss your friends, plus be late for lessons.

steps.title: Once you get to the school gate, people will almost certainly say "Happy Birthday!"
steps.content: Once you get to the school gate, people will almost certainly say "Happy Birthday!" and give you hugs. If this happens, say something friendly, like "Thanks!" or "Can't wait till tonight!" If you receive presents, say thank you. Of course, it is entirely your choice whether you open them there in front of your friends. You could just pop them in your bag to save for later. However, do look at the parcel, be careful with presents, say thank you and be appreciative.

steps.title: Of course, there may be some silly people who are nasty to people, whether it's their birthday or not.
steps.content: Of course, there may be some silly people who are nasty to people, whether it's their birthday or not. This can be upsetting, even if it's just a stupid comment that people say. A good way to deal with this is to spend time with your friends, ones who are really nice, caring and talkative, not your so called "mates" who make you feel miserable. If someone is mean enough to be spiteful you could say "It's my birthday today so I'm going to do things that I enjoy, and not waste my time talking to you" or, if they call you a name, something like "That's not true. Now if you wouldn't mind, I have a birthday to enjoy, so bye!" and you could walk away. Names can really hurt, so try not to let people ruin your day. Just think of the presents and cards you'll get later and you will probably cheer up. However, do confide in a close friend if someone is upsetting you a lot. They can support you and be a friend.

steps.title: Some lessons are really great fun, and your teachers are all bound to be extra nice and pleasant to you.
steps.content: Some lessons are really great fun, and your teachers are all bound to be extra nice and pleasant to you. Listen, contribute and work hard. Getting positive comments can make your day even better!

steps.title: Eat with your mates, go to the library and read or write, even make a start on any homework you may have (after all, it means not having to do it at home and gives you extra time to do stuff like going on the computer and watching TV).
steps.content: Eat with your mates, go to the library and read or write, even make a start on any homework you may have (after all, it means not having to do it at home and gives you extra time to do stuff like going on the computer and watching TV). You could also just hang out with your friends and chat.

steps.title: When you go home, do things you enjoy (like using the computer, watching TV, reading, listening to music etc.
steps.content: When you go home, do things you enjoy (like using the computer, watching TV, reading, listening to music etc. ), but first finish any homework you might have (as you wouldn't want to be reminded about it when opening your presents!) Have a birthday tea with yummy food,make a special wish and eat your cake, open your presents, say thank you. Enjoy your day!
